      EventHubConfiguration.Builder fromEnvironmentVariables(String authURL)
      When the Event Hub instance is bound to the application, the environment variable EVENTHUB_INSTANCE_NAME is defined, and the authURL is provided, this method will populate all the required Event Hub configuration fields to connect to Event Hub.

      When both the Event Hub and UAA instances are bound to the application, this will automatically populate all the required Event Hub configuration fields based on the services names provided in the parameters

      • authURL

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder authURL(String authURL)
        Configures the OAuth2 issuer URI
        Parameters:
        authURL - The URI to the OAuth2 issuer. For UAA, this can be found in VCAP_SERVICES of the UAA instance under "issuerId"
        Returns:
        Builder

      • automaticTokenRenew

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder automaticTokenRenew(boolean automaticTokenRenew)
        Configures whether or not the SDK will handle getting and renewing token
        Parameters:
        automaticTokenRenew - Default is true. Requires clientID, clientSecret and authURL to be set
        Returns:
        Builder

      • publishConfiguration

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder publishConfiguration(PublishConfiguration publishConfiguration)
        Configures the publish configuration
        Parameters:
        publishConfiguration - Publish configuration. Default is the ASYNC configuration
        Returns:
        Builder

        Set the logger config for the client
        Parameters:
        loggerConfiguration - the configuration to use
        Returns:
        Builder

      • subscribeConfiguration

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder subscribeConfiguration(SubscribeConfiguration subscribeConfiguration)
        Configures the subscribe configuration
        Parameters:
        subscribeConfiguration - Subscribe configuration. Default has the default subscriber name and instance
        Returns:
        Builder

      • authScopes

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder authScopes(String authScopes)
        Configures the specific scopes to request from the OAuth issuer
        Parameters:
        authScopes - Comma delimited scopes. Use only if scope requested must be specific
        Returns:
        Builder

      • reconnectRetryLimit

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder reconnectRetryLimit(Integer reconnectRetryLimit)
                                                  throws EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException
        Configures number of retries for reconnecting to Event Hub Service
        Parameters:
        reconnectRetryLimit - Integer between 0 and 5 (inclusive).
        Returns:
        Builder
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException

      • fromEnvironmentVariables

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder fromEnvironmentVariables()
                                                       throws EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException
        When both Event Hub and UAA instances are bound to the application and the respective service instance names are defined in the environment variables EVENTHUB_INSTANCE_NAME and UAA_INSTANCE_NAME, this will automatically populate all the required Event Hub configuration fields to connect to Event Hub
        Returns:
        Builder
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException - Thrown when the environment variables are not set, instance not found or parsing error

      • fromEnvironmentVariables

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder fromEnvironmentVariables(String authURL)
                                                       throws EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException
        When the Event Hub instance is bound to the application, the environment variable EVENTHUB_INSTANCE_NAME is defined, and the authURL is provided, this method will populate all the required Event Hub configuration fields to connect to Event Hub.
        Returns:
        Builder
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException - Thrown when the environment variables are not set, instance not found or parsing error

      • fromEnvironmentVariablesWithInstance

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder fromEnvironmentVariablesWithInstance(String eventhubInstanceName)
                                                                   throws EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException
        When the Event Hub is bound to the application, this will automatically populate the fields relating to Event Hub but NOT fields relating to OAuth2

        This is useful when the OAuth2 client is not UAA or not in Cloud Foundry. This *must* be used with automaticTokenRenew as false

        Parameters:
        eventhubInstanceName - Name of Event Hub service instance
        Returns:
        Builder
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException - Thrown when instances are not found or parsing error

      • fromEnvironmentVariables

        public EventHubConfiguration.Builder fromEnvironmentVariables(String eventhubInstanceName,
                                                              String uaaInstanceName)
                                                       throws EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException
        When both the Event Hub and UAA instances are bound to the application, this will automatically populate all the required Event Hub configuration fields based on the services names provided in the parameters

        This is useful when there are multiple Event Hub instances which all share the same or different UAA instances.

        Parameters:
        eventhubInstanceName - Name of Event Hub service instance
        uaaInstanceName - Name of UAA service instance
        Returns:
        Builder
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException - Thrown when instances are not found or parsing error

      • build

        public EventHubConfiguration build()
                            throws EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException
        Builds the complete configuration to create a new Event Hub client
        Returns:
        A new EventHubConfiguration
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException.InvalidConfigurationException - Thrown when not all required fields are set
